title: Wish / If Only
description: Слушайте выражения сожаления с wish и if only.

tasks.audioText: Tom is stuck in traffic again on his way to work. He wishes he lived closer to the office.
tasks.transcript: He wishes he lived closer to the office.

options.text: He regrets that his home is far from his workplace.
He recently moved closer to the office.
He enjoys the long commute to work every day.
He is planning to change his office location.

tasks.explanation: 'Wish + past simple' expresses a desire for the present situation to be different. He wants to live closer but doesn't.

tasks.audioText: Clara failed her driving test for the third time yesterday. She wishes she had practised parallel parking more before the exam.
tasks.transcript: She wishes she had practised parallel parking more before the exam.

options.text: She practised enough and passed the test easily.
She regrets not spending more time on parallel parking preparation.
She plans to practise parking before her next test.
She doesn't need to learn parallel parking.

tasks.explanation: 'Wish + past perfect' expresses regret about a past event. She didn't practise enough and now regrets it.

tasks.audioText: The neighbours are having a loud party at midnight. If only they would turn the music down so we could sleep.
tasks.transcript: If only they would turn the music down so we could sleep.

options.text: The speaker wants the neighbours to reduce the volume.
The neighbours agreed to turn down the music.
The speaker enjoys listening to the neighbours' music.
The speaker is planning to join the neighbours' party.

tasks.explanation: 'If only + would' expresses annoyance about someone else's behaviour and a wish for them to change it.

tasks.audioText: Robert invested all his savings in a risky startup that failed. He wishes he hadn't put all his money into one company.
tasks.transcript: He wishes he hadn't put all his money into one company.

options.text: He is glad he invested everything in the startup.
He regrets concentrating all his investment in a single business.
He never invested any money in startups.
He plans to invest more money in the same company.

tasks.explanation: 'Wish + past perfect negative' expresses regret about something that did happen. He invested everything and now regrets it.

tasks.audioText: Emma is sitting in a boring meeting that has been going on for three hours. She wishes she could leave right now.
tasks.transcript: She wishes she could leave right now.

options.text: She is free to leave the meeting whenever she wants.
She wants to leave the meeting but is unable to.
She left the meeting after the first hour.
She finds the meeting extremely interesting.

tasks.explanation: 'Wish + could' expresses a desire for an ability or possibility that doesn't currently exist. She can't leave but wants to.

tasks.audioText: Michael dropped out of university twenty years ago to pursue music. If only he had finished his degree, he might have more career options now.
tasks.transcript: If only he had finished his degree, he might have more career options now.

options.text: He completed his degree and has many career choices.
He feels that not completing university limited his career possibilities.
He is currently studying for his degree part-time.
He doesn't regret leaving university at all.

tasks.explanation: 'If only + past perfect' expresses a strong regret about a past decision. Not finishing his degree reduced his opportunities.

tasks.audioText: Anna is a talented artist who works as an accountant. She wishes she were brave enough to pursue her passion full-time.
tasks.transcript: She wishes she were brave enough to pursue her passion full-time.

options.text: She already works as a full-time artist.
She desires more courage to follow her artistic dreams professionally.
She has no interest in art as a career.
She is very brave and pursues every opportunity.

tasks.explanation: 'Wish + were' (subjunctive) expresses a wish about the present. She feels she lacks the courage to become a full-time artist.

tasks.audioText: It hasn't rained in weeks and the garden is completely dried out. I wish it would rain soon so the plants could recover.
tasks.transcript: I wish it would rain soon so the plants could recover.

options.text: The speaker hopes for rainfall to help the dying garden.
It has been raining too much and the garden is flooded.
The speaker doesn't care about the garden plants.
The garden is thriving despite the dry weather.

tasks.explanation: 'Wish + would' can express a desire for a situation or external circumstances to change in the future.

tasks.audioText: Sandra missed the deadline for a scholarship application by one day. If only she had submitted it on time, she would have received the funding.
tasks.transcript: If only she had submitted it on time, she would have received the funding.

options.text: She submitted the application on time and got the scholarship.
She regrets missing the deadline because it cost her the scholarship.
She decided not to apply for the scholarship.
The scholarship deadline was extended for her.

tasks.explanation: 'If only + past perfect' combined with 'would have received' expresses deep regret about a missed opportunity in the past.

tasks.audioText: Peter speaks only English and often struggles when travelling abroad. He wishes he spoke at least one more language fluently.
tasks.transcript: He wishes he spoke at least one more language fluently.

options.text: He is fluent in several foreign languages.
He has no desire to learn other languages.
He regrets being monolingual and wants to know another language well.
He is currently studying three languages at once.

tasks.explanation: 'Wish + past simple' (spoke) expresses dissatisfaction with the current situation. He wants to be multilingual but isn't.

tasks.audioText: Lucy ate an entire chocolate cake by herself last night. She wishes she hadn't eaten so much because she feels terrible today.
tasks.transcript: She wishes she hadn't eaten so much because she feels terrible today.

options.text: She regrets overeating since it made her feel unwell.
She ate a small piece of cake and feels fine.
She is happy about eating the whole cake.
She plans to eat another cake tonight.

tasks.explanation: 'Wish + past perfect negative' shows regret about a completed past action. She ate too much and now suffers the consequences.

tasks.audioText: James is working on a tight project deadline with no help. He wishes his colleagues would offer to assist instead of watching him struggle.
tasks.transcript: He wishes his colleagues would offer to assist instead of watching him struggle.

options.text: His colleagues are helping him with the project.
He is frustrated that his coworkers aren't volunteering to help.
He prefers to work alone on all projects.
He asked his colleagues for help and they agreed.

tasks.explanation: 'Wish + would' expresses irritation about others' behaviour. He's annoyed that his colleagues are not offering help.

tasks.audioText: The old house is beautiful but in terrible condition. If only we had enough money to restore it properly.
tasks.transcript: If only we had enough money to restore it properly.

options.text: They have sufficient funds to renovate the house.
They wish they could afford the proper restoration of the house.
They have no interest in restoring the old house.
They already finished restoring the house.

tasks.explanation: 'If only + past simple' expresses a strong wish about the present. They lack the money needed for restoration.

tasks.audioText: Daniel said something hurtful to his best friend during an argument. He wishes he could take back what he said.
tasks.transcript: He wishes he could take back what he said.

options.text: He wants to unsay his hurtful words but knows it's impossible.
He doesn't regret what he said to his friend.
He successfully apologized and everything is fine.
His friend said something hurtful to him first.

tasks.explanation: 'Wish + could' expresses a desire for an impossible present action. He can't undo his words but wants to.

tasks.audioText: Maria's flight was cancelled due to a snowstorm. She wishes she had booked a train ticket as a backup option.
tasks.transcript: She wishes she had booked a train ticket as a backup option.

options.text: She had a backup train ticket ready.
She prefers flying over taking the train.
She regrets not arranging alternative transportation in advance.
The snowstorm didn't affect her travel plans at all.

tasks.explanation: 'Wish + past perfect' expresses regret about a past decision. She didn't book a train ticket and now wishes she had.

short_description: Сожаления и пожелания с wish и if only.
